result.execSummary:
The defendant Jefferson J Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with 0 days credit.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 18 months thereafter.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero.
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA);
All applicable fees of supervision.
- No cash bail posted in this matter.
- If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection from 25% of funds under Sec.973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: First month Huber for medical. Last 5 months with GPS monitoring if deemed appropriate by the House of Corrections and Huber for work, treatment, and medical.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jefferson J Daniels

records.addlTxt: Defendant did not respond to staff attorney's letter dated 7/23/20.  Request deemed abandoned.
Letter to defendant
Letter Request for IID Exemption upon sworn affidavit, received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time.  First month Huber for medical. Last 5 months with GPS monitoring if deemed appropriate by the House of Corrections and Huber for work, treatment and medical.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  18 MONTHS  thereafter.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
IDP Related Offense Assessment
Letter from Victim

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jefferson J Daniels in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count 2 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Jefferson J Daniels in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense is requesting more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. css

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program Or JusticePoint Pretrial Services.. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. 
IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jefferson J Daniels in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
